title: A Step-by-Step Guide to Axolotl Breeding in Minecraft

steps.title: Gather 2 axolotls in a location with water.
steps.content: Gather 2 axolotls in a location with water. Collect wild axolotls using an empty bucket —you can find them swimming around the lush caves biome. Bring them back to an enclosed location on your farm that has a pool of water. Similar to frogs, axolotls can’t be “tamed” like wolves and cats . To automatically get the lush cave biome, create a new world with seeds like: 4726055113674905895 -6281032827949366960 8982479184696970002 You can also attach a lead to an axolotl and guide it around. Just keep it close to the water, as axolotls die if they spend more than 5 minutes continuously on land. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Feed both axolotls with 2 buckets of tropical fish.
steps.content: Feed both axolotls with 2 buckets of tropical fish. While holding a bucket of tropical fish, right-click on each axolotl to feed them—you’ll need 2 buckets to feed both. Hearts will appear over both axolotls’ heads, and a few seconds later, a baby axolotl will be born. To get a bucket of tropical fish: Scoop up a tropical fish in a bucket. These fish are found in oceans, lush caves (like axolotls), and mangrove swamps. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Wait 20 minutes for the baby axolotl to grow up.
steps.content: Wait 20 minutes for the baby axolotl to grow up. Expect the baby axolotl to stick around their parents until they’re fully grown up.

steps.title: It’s very hard—there’s less than a 0.1% chance of breeding a blue axolotl.
steps.content: It’s very hard—there’s less than a 0.1% chance of breeding a blue axolotl. Breeding is the only way to get a blue axolotl without cheats, so you just have to continuously breed axolotls until you get the right color. Java Edition Cheat: /summon axolotl ~ ~ ~ {Variant:4 } Bedrock Edition Cheat: /summon axolotl ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ minecraft:entity_born

steps.title: Axolotls are passive but will be aggressive to certain aquatic creatures.
steps.content: Axolotls are passive but will be aggressive to certain aquatic creatures. Axolotls won’t attack dolphins, frogs, or turtles, but they will attack most other aquatic mobs, like squid, tropical fish, and Guardians. Axolotls are aggressive toward Drowned mobs, too.
